definition: to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: To tell you the truth, I did not like her. I thought she was too much enchanting.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，起初我並不喜歡她，感覺她太妖嬈了。

sentences.english: So, why not speak the truth?
sentences.chinese: 既然如此，爲什麼不說實話呢？

sentences.english: Honestly, the rate of commi ion you are going to grant us is far too small.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，你方給我們的導航已取消怎麼辦佣金太少了。

sentences.english: Honestly, I don’t often think about the state of ‘emo’.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，我不常思考‘emo’的狀況。
“那麼最好跟他們說實話，”吉夫說。

sentences.english: To be honest I needed to check the spelling first.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，我得先看看自己有沒有拼對詞。

sentences.english: If he said that，he can’t be telling the truth.
sentences.chinese: 如果他說了那樣的話，他不可能是說實話。

sentences.english: To be realistic a past accident makes more sense.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，說是過去的一次事故更合乎情理。

sentences.english: Well, to be honest, go to school.
Honestly, it was our most dramatic marital fight to date.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，這是我們結婚來吵得最兇的一次。

sentences.english: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，親愛的，我不管你屁事。

sentences.english: You should always tell the truth .
You should always tell the truth.
Upon my word, the road's pretty bumpy just here.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，這兒的路真的不平。

sentences.english: I hear a newly-invented drug can make people tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說有種新研製的藥能使人說實話。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, I don't like disco.
sentences.chinese: 說實話，我不喜歡迪斯可。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
at the minimum/at the very least
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
